newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Brent faces strong $18.45-50 resistance.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Brent faces strong $18.45-50 resistance.

text.p: NEARBY MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI-14 * MA-10 * MA-20
+ Brent has repeatedly failed to break through key resistance in the $18.45-$18.48 area, the level of a key falling trendline on the weekly chart.
+ September Brent, which takes up the front-month reins today, has formed a perfect triple top at $18.50 this week and this, too, forms another obstacle.
IPE Brent crude oil futures face strong resistance at $18.45, $18.48 and $18.50 and this is likely to keep a lid on prices for the moment, technical analysts said.
September Brent crude, which is the new front month from today, closed at $18.30 a barrel on Wednesday, seven cents a barrel down on the day. August gas oil was a dollar firmer at $163.75.
Peter Sceats at CharTech-MCS said Brent would face resistance up at a key falling trendline formed on the weekly chart, dating from mid-May.

"The resistance line for this trend crosses the price action at the $18.47 area in the coming week," he said in a weekly report which was released early on Monday. "Spot Brent is likely to find strong resistance at that area."
Front-month Brent reached highs of $18.45, $18.48 and $18.45 respectively on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday and this imperfect triple top in itself is likely to reinforce resistance at this level.
On the chart for September Brent has formed a perfect triple top - reaching a high of $18.50 on each of the first three days of this week.
Fenalla Graham at MeesPierson Derivatives in London, employing the Market Profile technique, said she saw first resistance for Brent at $18.45 and then at $18.60.

"Crude markets are hovering up against tough range resistance but do not seem to have the strength to break through as yet," she said in a daily report. She placed support levels at $18.24, $18.18 and $18.00.
But she warned that while preparation was neutral in Brent and NYMEX crude, products were positive. "With the fear that crudes may take heed of products we continue to buy dips in all markets.
Support for gas oil would be encountered at $163.50, $163.00 and $162.50, while resistance was located at $164.75, $165.25 and $167.25.
